examples/odt.php

00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Using QueryPath to parse an Open Document Type (ODT) text file.
00004  *
00005  * The ODT format is a standard way of representing word processing documents.
00006  * It is based on a combination of technologies, one of which is XML. Document
00007  * text is stored in a structural (semantic) XML document, while other information,
00008  * such as style sheets, are stored in auxilliary files.
00009  *
00010  * This example shows how ODT files can be opened and manipulated using QueryPath.
00011  *
00012  * The file used here was generated by OpenOffice 3.x. Other word processors are 
00013  * also capable of generating ODT files.
00014  *
00015  * 
00016  * @author M Butcher <matt@aleph-null.tv>
00017  * @license LGPL The GNU Lesser GPL (LGPL) or an MIT-like license.
00018  */
00019 
00020 /** Include main QP library. */
00021 require_once '../src/QueryPath/QueryPath.php';
00022 
00023 // If you have the Zip lib combiled in: 
00024 //$file = 'zip://openoffice.odt#content';
00025 // Example for systems w/o zip lib:
00026 $file = 'tmp/content.xml';
00027 $doc = qp($file);
00028 print 'Contents:' . PHP_EOL;
00029 
00030 // Show the "outline": all of the heading items:
00031 foreach ($doc->find('text|h') as $header) {
00032   $style = $header->attr('text:style-name');
00033   $attr_parts = explode('_', $style);
00034   $level = array_pop($attr_parts);
00035   $out = str_repeat('  ', $level) . '- ' . $header->text();
00036   print $out . PHP_EOL;
00037 }
00038 
00039 // This is a fairly sophisticated selector. It gets the first
00040 // <text:list text:style-name="L1"> match and then gets the 
00041 // <text:p text:style-name="P1"> elements. That is the syntax for
00042 // ODT lists. Not elegant....
00043 $selector = 'text|list[text|style-name="L1"]:first text|p[text|style-name="P1"]';
00044 
00045 print PHP_EOL . "Bullet List" . PHP_EOL;
00046 foreach ($doc->top()->find($selector) as $bullet) {
00047   print '  * ' . $bullet->text() . PHP_EOL;
00048 }
00049 
00050 print PHP_EOL . "Ordered List" . PHP_EOL;
00051 $i = 0;
00052 foreach ($doc->top()->find('text|list[text|style-name="L2"]:first text|p[text|style-name="P2"]') as $bullet) {
00053   print '  ' . (++$i) . '. '. $bullet->text() . PHP_EOL;
00054 }
